item.title: Developers and TLS what could possibly go wrong
item.description: The problem of not using TLS in developer machines Lots of time ago, at the time Windows Communication Foundation was a thing, there were good automatic protections by Microsoft that prevent passing credentials in clear text over an unencrypted (non TLS) channel. I was amazed by the number of solution you can find in the internet that to solve the problem suggests to developer to create an unsecure channel that does not perform this check, allowing for clear text credential to be sent in a standard HTTP channel.
